title: Writing About Environmental Issues
description: Write about an environmental problem and suggest solutions.

prompt.topic: An Environmental Problem and Its Solutions
prompt.description: Choose an environmental problem that concerns you (such as plastic pollution, climate change, or deforestation). Describe the problem, explain why it is serious, and suggest what people can do to help solve it.
requirements: Explain why this problem is serious
Use comparison structures (more than, less than, as...as, the more...the more)

exampleSentences.sentence: One of the most serious environmental problems today is plastic pollution.
exampleSentences.translation: 오늘날 가장 심각한 환경 문제 중 하나는 플라스틱 오염이에요.
exampleSentences.useCase: To introduce the topic with a superlative

exampleSentences.sentence: This problem is getting worse and worse each year.
exampleSentences.translation: 이 문제는 매년 점점 더 심해지고 있어요.

exampleSentences.sentence: Plastic is less biodegradable than natural materials.
The more we recycle, the less pollution we create.
exampleSentences.translation: 우리가 더 많이 재활용할수록 오염을 덜 만들어요.

exampleSentences.sentence: In my opinion, governments should do more to protect the environment.
exampleSentences.translation: 제 생각에 정부는 환경 보호를 위해 더 많은 일을 해야 해요.

exampleSentences.sentence: If we all make small changes, we can make a big difference.
exampleSentences.translation: 우리 모두가 작은 변화를 만들면 큰 차이를 만들 수 있어요.

vocabularyHelp.example: We should invest in renewable energy.

usefulExpressions.expression: One of the most serious problems is...
usefulExpressions.usage: To introduce a problem with emphasis
usefulExpressions.example: One of the most serious problems is deforestation.
The more we plant trees, the more carbon dioxide is absorbed.

usefulExpressions.usage: To add emphasis to multiple points
usefulExpressions.example: Recycling not only reduces waste but also saves energy.
Unless we act now, many species will become extinct.
I strongly believe that everyone should do their part.

items: Did you clearly identify an environmental problem?
Did you explain why it is serious?
Did you suggest at least two solutions?
Did you give your personal opinion?
Did you use comparative and superlative forms correctly?
Did you use 'the more... the more' structure?
Did you organize your ideas logically?
Did you vary your sentence structures?
Did you use formal language appropriately?
Is your writing at least 130 words?
Is your writing no more than 180 words?
Does your writing have an introduction, body, and conclusion?
Did you complete within the time limit?
